intro: Stemodiacra senegalensis, commonly known as the Senegalese stemodia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in moist, sandy soils near rivers and coastal areas. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
